intro: Polycycnopsis tortuosa, commonly known as the spiral-leaved sedge, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and spiral arrangement of leaves, which give it its common name. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically arranged in clusters at the base of the plant. Polycycnopsis tortuosa is often found in marshy areas and is adapted to thrive in saturated soil conditions.
